thread.title: LIRR: Broken rail near East River tunnel disrupts p.m. commute
thread.title_full: LIRR: Broken rail near East River tunnel disrupts p.m. commute

title: LIRR: Broken rail near East River tunnel disrupts p.m. commute
text:
LIRR: Broken rail near East River tunnel disrupts p.m. commute Updated January 11, 2017 6:56 PM By Alfonso A. Castillo and Vincent Barone , Reprints + - Long Island Rail Road passengers headed to a Port Washington train at Pennsylvania Station after a broken rail caused delays on Wednesday, Jan. 11, 2017. Amtrak crews are working to repair a broken rail found outside one of Amtrak's East River Tunnels. Photo Credit: Charles Eckert 
advertisement | advertise on newsday Long Island Rail Road passengers headed to a Port Washington train at Pennsylvania Station after a broken rail caused delays on Wednesday, Jan. 11, 2017. Amtrak crews are working to repair a broken rail found outside one of Amtrak's East River Tunnels. (Credit: Charles Eckert) 
Long Island Rail Road passengers are enduring a difficult Wednesday evening commute, as railroad officials say a broken rail is causing delays, cancellations and service suspensions. 
The LIRR notified riders shortly before 3 p.m. that they should “expect train cancellations and delays during Wednesday’s afternoon rush hour while Amtrak crews work to repair a broken rail found outside one of...
